title: Comparative Analysis of Retinal Image Segmentation Techniques for Glaucoma Diagnosis

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical imaging comprehension and familiarity with machine learning fundamentals
context.additional_context: Strengthening practical skills through project-based assessment in smartphone-centric learning environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain the clinical significance of retinal structures (OC/OD) utilized in glaucoma diagnosis
Learners can compare differences between traditional image segmentation techniques (thresholding/region growing) and deep learning methods (U-Net/FCN)
Learners can select segmentation algorithms applicable to real retinal image datasets and interpret performance evaluation metrics

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
